25 Years of Legislative Theatre

25 Years of Legislative Theatre

Section titled â€œ25 Years of Legislative Theatreâ€

Every decade, a new promise.
Every decade, the same collapse.

Western Australia has spent 25 years performing the same act â€”
ğŸ­ Ministers proclaim â€œmodern law.â€
ğŸ•³ï¸ FOI proves no enforcement system ever existed.
ğŸ” The cycle restarts.

Symbol Guide:

  • ğŸ­ Legislative promise or announcement
  • ğŸ•³ï¸ FOI-documented void (no implementation)
  • ğŸ” Pattern repeats

What follows is not history. It is evidence arranged chronologically.

The 2023 media release and FAQ presented a total illusion â€” a functioning, professional compliance regime with trained inspectors and proactive monitoring.
The first FOI decision exposed that none of it existed.
What was sold as transparency was, in fact, theatre.

â€œThe AWAC will advise the Ministerâ€¦on the development and implementation of standards relevant to training and competency assessment of appointed inspectors under the Act.â€

    • âˆ… No AWAC meeting records
    • âˆ… No DI supervision or training standards
    • âˆ… No risk assessments or annual reports
  • Section 26 notice issued: â€œDocuments do not exist.â€

ğŸ“„ Hansard â€“ AWAC Non-Statutory Status (2025)
ğŸ“„ FOI Decision â€“ Oversight & Risk (FOI 2)

Structural finding:
AWAC functions as a faÃ§ade of independence â€” a non-statutory advisory shell designed to simulate oversight while producing no enforceable output.
Its Terms of Reference promised supervision of inspector training and annual reporting; FOI 2 revealed that neither has ever occurred.
AWACâ€™s existence is symbolic, not functional â€” consultation without record, advice without consequence.

ğŸ” Structural Patterns (2001â€“2025)

Section titled â€œğŸ” Structural Patterns (2001â€“2025)â€

1ï¸âƒ£ Pattern 1 â€“ The Empty Promise Cycle

Section titled â€œ1ï¸âƒ£ Pattern 1 â€“ The Empty Promise Cycleâ€

(Each decade repeats the same announcement of â€œmodernizationâ€)

  • 2001: â€œAustraliaâ€™s most modern legislation.â€
  • 2011: â€œSix full-time inspectorsâ€ announced.
  • 2021: â€œModernizationâ€ commitments after the Linda Black Review.
  • 2025: 4,043 citizens still petitioning for the same reforms.

Meaning:
Every generation renews the same language of reform, but never the mechanisms to realise it. The rhetoric evolves; the vacuum remains.

2ï¸âƒ£ Pattern 2 â€“ The Institutionalized Regulatory Facade

Section titled â€œ2ï¸âƒ£ Pattern 2 â€“ The Institutionalized Regulatory Facadeâ€

(The appearance of oversight replaces the act of oversight)

  • 2007â€“2008: Six-inspector program collapses after two years.
  • 2010: Minister admits inspection data â€œcurrently not available.â€
  • 2023: Designated Inspector system legislated.
  • 2025 FOI: Zero SOPs, zero training records, zero inspection data.

Meaning:
Enforcement exists only as a concept. Each â€œnew systemâ€ inherits the same emptiness â€” procedure without practice, title without function.

3ï¸âƒ£ Pattern 3 â€“ Accountability Substitutes

Section titled â€œ3ï¸âƒ£ Pattern 3 â€“ Accountability Substitutesâ€

(When real oversight is politically or structurally impossible)

  • 2010 â†’ 2025: RSPCA funding used as a substitute for government enforcement.
  • 2015: RSPCA politically targeted after successful prosecutions.
  • 2022: AWAC established as a non-statutory advisory body.
  • 2025: FOI confirms AWAC never discussed DI oversight since 2023.

Meaning:
Responsibility is displaced onto entities that cannot compel change.
When oversight succeeds, it is punished; when it fails, it is praised.
This is not collapse â€” it is design.

Structural Conclusion

Section titled â€œStructural Conclusionâ€

This is not a history of failed reforms.
It is a pattern of performance:

  1. Announce a â€œmodernâ€ framework
  2. Generate headlines with funding or committees
  3. Create oversight bodies without power
  4. Never implement enforcement
  5. Repeat

For 25 years, Parliament performed.
FOI proved nothing ever followed.

The Animal Welfare Act 2002 was a foundation myth.
The six-inspector scheme was a two-year stunt.
The DI system was a cover for trespass penalties.
The AWAC was an empty shell.

What remains is not reform, but an archive of absence.

Archival Note
All claims are verbatim from Hansard, Acts, or FOI.
All absences are FOI-verified.

What Parliament promised, FOI disproved.
This archive preserves bothâ€”side by side.
